main event: Observers watched a round ball of light appearing about the size of a grapefruit in Worland, Wyoming, on December 22, 1967.
interesting points: The light exhibited a pulsing or flashing effect,It was observed in the north-northwest sky and appeared stationary at times,The object was observed for approximately 5 minutes,The sighting may have been caused by hot air balloons launched the previous evening by a family in the area,There were assertions that this incident may be linked to weather patterns influencing the visibility of objects in the sky.
